title: Election 2021: 'I was homeless now I'm voting for the first time'
description: Aaron Scullion was homeless at 21 but he now has a job and home and is voting for the first time.

title: Britney Spears: Does the latest documentary tell us anything new?
description: Another new documentary examining the singer's conservatorship is released this weekend.

title: Long-distance relationships are tough - but lockdown helped this couple
description: "In the first lockdown we couldn't see each other. This is round two, just an ocean apart."

title: Bobby Sands: The hunger strike that changed the course of N Ireland's conflict
description: A hunger strike in which 10 IRA prisoners died was a watershed in the Troubles, says Peter Taylor.

title: Week in pictures: 24 - 30 April 2021
description: A selection of powerful images taken around the world this week.

title: Covid: Fears of 'impending doom' in Pakistan
description: A slow vaccine roll out, no lockdown and large gatherings are concerning doctors in Pakistan.

title: Singapore: What's it like in the best place to live during Covid?
description: As the pandemic continues to devastate, one Asian island has emerged as the best place to ride it out.

title: Why is this the 'most instagrammable' bird?
description: How a study designated the rare, odd-looking frogmouth the most instagrammable of avian species.

title: Wood burners: Sale of coal and wet wood restricted in England
description: Owners of wood burners and open fires will need to burn cleaner alternatives as new rules come into force.

title: South Asians in UK at greater risk from Covid
description: People from an Indian, Pakistani or Bangladeshi background suffered more, the Lancet study shows.

title: Domestic Abuse Bill: For these victims, a new law is long overdue
description: The landmark Domestic Abuse Bill became law this week. Two survivors describe what it means for them.

title: Planning my 'big Greek wedding' in a pandemic
description: Restrictions on wedding guest numbers are due to be lifted on 21 June, but couples are still anxious.

title: Do you know where plastic waste in the oceans is coming from?
description: The Ocean Cleanup suggests plastic pollution comes from more rivers in the world than previously thought.

title: Mars Ingenuity helicopter mission extended by Nasa
description: Nasa is so pleased with the success of the Ingenuity helicopter, it is extending its mission.

title: Elections 2021: How to follow the results on the BBC
description: Find out how to keep up to date with live election results on TV, radio, online and on social media.

title: Cornholme erotic books note attacks 'cesspit' Hebden Bridge
description: A village goes viral when an angry note appears on its book-swap box railing against "filthy" titles.

title: Elections 2021: Why a lack of buses is a key issue for voters
description: Infrequent buses and cancelled services - why public transport is a vital topic for young voters.

title: 'Disaster Girl' sells iconic meme for £340,000
description: Zoë Roth, 21, will use the money from the sale of a 2005 image of her to pay her student loan.

title: Ian Wright and Alan Shearer discuss the impact of racist online abuse
description: Ian Wright sits down with Alan Shearer to discuss the effect of racist abuse online and shows him an abusive direct message he received that morning.

title: Israel crush: Witnesses tell of people 'thrown up in the air'
description: Those at the Lag B'Omer festival, where dozens died, say they were "swept along" by the crowd.

title: Player quits football at half-time after alleged suicide taunt
description: Albion Rovers' David Cox says he has quit football after claiming he was verbally abused about his mental health struggles by an opposition player.

title: Brexit: Anger over government's failure to get Norway fishing deal
description: One Hull-based trawler, which catches 10% of fish for UK chip shops, will be out of action for a year.

title: Bronze Age treasure found in Swedish forest by mapmaker
description: A man stumbled on ancient jewellery while surveying a forest for his orienteering club.

title: Benjamin Hannam: Met PC who was neo-Nazi group member is jailed
description: Benjamin Hannam was the first British officer to be convicted of a terrorism offence.

title: Covid-19 infections in UK back to late summer levels - ONS
description: The ONS estimates infections are 20 times lower than at the peak in January with 0.1% infected.

title: Boris Johnson's personal mobile phone number available online for 15 years

title: Noel Clarke: Sky halts work with actor after harassment allegations
description: The broadcaster says it has "halted" the Bulletproof star's involvement in any future productions.

title: Co-op to scrap plastic 'bags for life'
description: The supermarket follows Morrisons in announcing it will ditch reusable plastic shopping bags.

title: Covid: UK clubbers set to return to Liverpool for trial night

title: Julia James: Police community officer died from head injuries
description: Police say they have no motive or suspects following the death of PCSO Julia James near Dover.

title: Sport social media boycott: The BBC abhors online abuse
description: The BBC outlines why it cannot join the social media boycott but pledges to continue to work hard to tackle abuse and expose and challenge racism.

description: Leading football clubs will be joined by a number of sporting bodies for a four-day boycott of social media to tackle abuse and discrimination.

description: How technology that generates fake faces is helping to tackle bias in facial recognition systems.
